metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17505 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: In HDF5 1.10.1, there is a NULL pointer dereference in the function H5O_pline_decode in the H5Opline.c file in libhdf5.a. For example, h5dump would crash when someone opens a crafted hdf5 file. It was discovered that HDF5 incorrectly handled certain hdf5 files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.4+repack-4').
